abstract: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar items. Tuesday's selection includes a tale of "Draw Something" zeal that faded, why one game developer at OMGpop didn't join Zynga and the development of an Apple mobile app.

snippet: New chips from Nvidia have better graphics and use less power. Just as important, they require cheaper components, which mean the costs of the products they appear in will likely fall sharply. Apple will likely soon face more tablet competitors in...
abstract: New chips from Nvidia have better graphics and use less power. Just as important, they require cheaper components, which mean the costs of the products they appear in will likely fall sharply. Apple will likely soon face more tablet competitors in the price range of the $199 Kindle Fire.

headline.main: Hints of a $199 Tablet and 3-D Chromebook

snippet: Strangely enough, there are few great gardening apps available, but this is such a big market opportunity that niche media companies are already joining the fray.
abstract: Strangely enough, there are few great gardening apps available, but this is such a big market opportunity that niche media companies are already joining the fray.

snippet: The issue of the shares will give Foxconn, the main manufacturer of Apple devices, about an 11 percent stake in Sharp, making it the top shareholder in Sharp.
abstract: The issue of the shares will give Foxconn, the main manufacturer of Apple devices, about an 11 percent stake in Sharp, making it the top shareholder in Sharp.

headline.main: Sharp to Sell Shares to Foxconn

snippet: When a mother forces her obese 7-year-old to lose weight, is that a success story or the beginning of a child's lifelong battle with weight and body image?
abstract: When a mother forces her obese 7-year-old to lose weight, is that a success story or the beginning of a child's lifelong battle with weight and body image?

snippet: A total of 175 stocks on the New York Stock Exchange touched 52-week highs on Tuesday.
abstract: Stocks fall in the day's trading but a total of 175 stocks on the New York Stock Exchange touched 52-week highs as portfolio managers buy top performers to dress up their portfolios near the end of the quarter.

headline.main: Shares Slip as Big Quarter Approaches Finish Line
